episodes.title: Johnny Depp's Lawyer on 5 Bombshell Moments in P. Diddy Sex Trafficking Trial
episodes.description:
The second week of Sean “Diddy” Combs’ federal trial is in the books. As the prosecution prepares another round of witnesses, Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber sits down with attorney Ben Chew, who famously represented Johnny Depp in civil court, to discuss the most major moments so far.

episodes.title: The Rise and Fall of P. Diddy’s Fortune
episodes.description:
Sean “Diddy” Combs was once estimated to have a $400M net worth. But since his arrested, his fortune has reportedly dropped in half. So, what happens to his money and estate if he’s convicted? What would happen to all of his businesses? Law&Crime’s Kennedi Walker has the answers.

episodes.title: Diddy Trial: New Witnesses Could Expose 'Dark Secrets'
episodes.description:
Music mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs is facing explosive federal racketeering charges—and prosecutors are about to call a lineup of powerful witnesses who could blow the case wide open. From alleged victims to former employees, the testimony ahead may expose disturbing new details about Combs’ inner circle and alleged criminal network. Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber is joined by General Counsel Elizabeth Vulaj to break down who’s expected to take the stand—and what’s really at stake in this high-profile federal trial.

episodes.title: P. Diddy on Trial: Kid Cudi's Car Bombing Testimony Rocks Court
episodes.description:
Prosecutors in Sean “Diddy” Combs federal sex trafficking and racketeering trial wrapped up week two with bombshell testimony from rapper Kid Cudi, whose real name is Scott Mescudi. He testified about Combs allegedly directing someone to blow up his car when Combs discovered his on-again, off-again girlfriend Cassie had been seeing Mescudi.  Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber and Elizabeth Millner go through all the latest details from inside the courtroom.

episodes.title: Diddy Trial AI: Cassie Ventura Testifies in Sex Trafficking Trial — Part One
episodes.description:
Sean “Diddy” Combs’ ex-girlfriend, identified by the feds as “Victim-1,” took the stand and testified in the famed music mogul’s trial on May 13. Casandra “Cassie” Ventura detailed how she got involved with Diddy and when their relationship took a shocking turn. Cassie was on the stand for four days, giving her side of the story during direct examination before being questioned by Diddy’s attorney. Law&Crime produced Cassie Ventura’s testimony using AI-generated content based on real court transcripts due to cameras being banned in federal court. Subscribe to watch all AI recreations of the Diddy trial and stay tuned for part two of Ventura’s testimony.

Produced by: Lamont Belton
Voice Acting by: Sierra Gillespie, Bobby Szoke

The following video was produced by Law&Crime with AI-generated content using real court transcripts from the Sean Combs trial. All of the audio and visuals were recreated using AI to simulate the trial proceedings in the courtroom. Precise body movements, expressions, hand movements, and vocal intonations have been presented by AI, but do not exactly mirror what physical movements transpired in the courtroom. Certain individuals shown, such as jurors and attendees in the gallery, are made of composite characters and do not represent the likeness or appearance of those individuals in real life. This is an ongoing trial. Sean “Diddy” Combs is presumed innocent unless proven guilty.

Regina Ventura, mother of Casandra “Cassie” Ventura, testified Tuesday that her family paid Sean “Diddy” Combs $20,000 in 2011 after taking out a home equity loan. episodes.description:
Week two of Sean “Diddy” Combs’ sex trafficking and racketeering trial got underway in federal court with testimony from Dawn Richard, a former member of the girl group “Danity Kane,” who claims to have witnessed Combs’ abuse of his then-girlfriend Casandra Ventura. Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber goes over all the details from inside the courtroom with correspondent Elizabeth Millner.

episodes.title: P. Diddy on Trial: Cassie Reveals Years of Alleged Abuse at Hands of Music Mogul
episodes.description:
As the prosecution’s star witness wrapped up her testimony against disgraced music mogul Sean “Diddy” Combs, a central question has been raised: why did Casandra Ventura continue dating Combs when she alleges he was abusing her? The answer could determine whether Combs is convicted on federal charges of sex trafficking. Law&Crime’s Jesse Weber analyzes the complex psychological implications with forensic psychiatrist Dr. Daniel Bober.
